business.headline: Large caps vs midcaps vs small caps: Where should you invest now?Markets witnessed a brief respite after closing their best week in 2025 last week. Broader markets, especially midcap and smallcap stocks, performed well. The BSE Midcap index gained 3%, while the BSE Smallcap index jumped 6% last week.
Need funds? Here's how to get a loan against mutual fundYou can apply online or visit the lender's branch by submitting a loan application form and providing details of your mutual fund holdings.

7th Pay Commission: DA hike announcement this week, likely before HoliOver 12 million central government employees and retirees are likely to benefit from the said hike under the 7th Pay Commission. With this possible revision, the DA would increase from 53% to 55% of the basic pay.

Defence boost from Europe? These 4 PSU stocks could see strong upsideAccording to ICICI Securities, defence companies that already have supply agreements, partnerships, or orders from European firms are likely to benefit the most. The brokerage firm has highlighted four companies that could gain from this.

Retail inflation likely fell below 4% in February: ReportAs fresh winter produce hit markets over the past few months, food items - which make up nearly half of the inflation basket - saw a sustained slowdown in price increases.

Is your startup looking for funding? Top 4 opportunities in IndiaOne of the biggest funding programmes available right now is the Startup Maha Rathi Challenge, which is part of Startup Mahakumbh 2025.

SRK wins tax dispute case: What is foreign tax credit and how to claim it? Khan had declared an income of Rs 83.42 crore in his tax return, but the tax officer reassessed it as Rs 84.17 crore and denied him foreign tax credit (FTC) for taxes paid in the UK.

IndusInd Bank share price hits 52-week low. Check target price and what's next?IndusInd Bank stock price: The sell-off came after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) approved only a one-year extension for CEO Sumant Kathpalia, despite the board recommending a three-year term.

Stock market bounces back, but will the relief rally last?Overall, the situation on Dalal Street looks much better than how it appeared at the beginning of last week. Does this mean investors can take it easy now?

EPFO announces new rules for EDLI Scheme: 3 key death benefits updatesThe EDLI scheme is part of the Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) and acts as a social security benefit, offering financial assistance to the dependents of an EPF member in the event of the untimely death of the EPF member while still employed.
Why are Tata Power shares rising today? Details here Tata Power stock has had a mixed run. The stock is down 20% in the past six months but has still gained 67% over the past two years.

Gensol Engineering shares crash 40% in a week. Why is it falling today?Gensol Engineering stock price: The shares of the company were down 3.99% to Rs 309.05 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 10:24 am. In early trade, the company's shares were trading even lower.

Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares fell over 5% in early tradeIndusInd Bank share price: The sell-off came after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) gave CEO Sumant Kathpalia a one-year extension instead of the three-year term the board had wanted.

Sensex gains 400 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todaySensex opened at 74,474.98, slightly higher than its previous close of 74,332.58. The index quickly gained over 350 points, reaching the day's high of 74,713.17.
Sensex, Nifty open higher as US Fed comments ease worries; IndusInd down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 114.62 points to 74,447.20, while the NSE Nifty50 added 42.25 points to 22,597.75 as of 9:25 AM.
Stock market today: What to expect from Sensex and Nifty? The Nifty ended at 22,552.50, while the Sensex closed at 74,332.58 in the last session, both gaining nearly 2% for the week.
Stocks to watch today: ONGC, HCLTech, IndusInd Bank, Tata PowerInvestors are expected to remain cautious due to uncertainty over US tariff threats and global market reactions.

Why family offices are crucial to India's 'Viksit Bharat by 2047' dream?At the India Today Conclave 2025, Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, discussed the growing role of family offices in India's journey towards becoming a developed economy by 2047. In a session titled "A Case for Tomorrow", moderated by Siddharth Zarabi, Shroff explained why family offices are vital for India's economic expansion and how they can contribute to achieving a Rs 30 trillion GDP target in the coming decades.

US Gold Card visa expensive, not worth it for Indians: Top law firm bossRishabh Shroff, partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, said Donald Trump's $5 million US Gold Card visa does not make sense for Indians as cheaper alternatives are available.

Why are the richest 1% leaving India? Law firm boss Rishabh Shroff explains Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, shared insights into the rising trend of high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs) acquiring foreign passports and moving their wealth abroad.

Pay is based on capability, not gender: Avarna Jain on pay gap in music industryAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Avarna Jain, Vice Chairperson of Saregama, spoke about the role of women in the workforce and addressed the long-debated issue of pay parity in the music and entertainment industry. She stated that in creative fields, women are leading the way, and pay is determined by ability and capability, not gender.

Place of TV will never be taken away: Anu Ranjan on OTTs replacing TVAnu Ranjan, President of The Indian Television Academy, said that television will remain relevant despite the rise of OTT platforms at the India Today Conclave 2025. She explained that while digital streaming services are growing, they cannot replace television, mainly due to affordability and accessibility.

Conclave 2025: Women leaders on breaking barriers, challenges and leadershipAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Namita Thapar, Executive Director of Emcure Pharmaceuticals, stated that businesses should be evaluated based on numbers, not gender. Speaking at the session "Breaking Barriers and Building Legacies," Thapar stressed that success in business depends on financial results, not whether a man or woman runs it.

Dalal Street logs best week of 2025. Will positive momentum continue?After a long spell of selling, investors on Dalal Street have finally got some relief. But does this mean the worst is over? Here is all you need to know.

Businesses should be judged by numbers, not gender: Namita Thapar International Women's Day: Namita Thapar, Executive Director of Emcure Pharmaceuticals, highlighted how financial results remain the key factor in business success, regardless of whether a man or a woman runs the company.

These 3 money deadlines you can't miss in March 2025If you want to secure better returns, deposit in these special fixed deposits, which are available only for a limited period. The last date for investing in these schemes is March 31, 2025.

Bengaluru's housing rent crisis triggers online debate. Details hereA recent social media post has ignited debate over Bengaluru's soaring rents, with users sharing how housing costs are outpacing salaries and making city living unaffordable.

How women investors are winning the race on Dalal StreetWomen are proving to be more disciplined investors, staying invested for longer periods and making better financial decisions. Their patience and careful approach often lead to higher returns compared to men.

Sebi warns Nestle over breach of insider trading regulations: ReportThe Indian arm of Swiss food giant Nestle said its compliance officer received an administrative warning letter from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) on Thursday.

Multiple PANs can attract Rs 10,000 fine. Here's how to avoid  Holding multiple PANs can complicate tax filings and financial transactions as different transactions are recorded under different PANs, resulting in errors, incorrect tax calculations, and possible scrutiny.

Donald Trump's US Strategic Bitcoin Reserve. All you need to know With this executive order, President Trump reinforces his commitment to make the US the 'crypto capital of the world.'

Looking for tax benefits under Section 80C? Check these 5 optionsThe contributions made to the Public Provident Fund qualify for tax deductions under Section 80C and the interest earned, along with the maturity amount, is tax-free.

Reliance share price jumps 3% today. Good time to buy stock?Reliance stock price: The company's stock was up 3.41% to Rs 1,251.80 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:56 am. However, it is still down over 20% compared to its 52-week high of Rs 1,608.95.

What is EPFO 3.0? 5 key things you can expect While inaugurating EPFO's Telangana zonal office and regional office in Hyderabad, Union Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya mentioned that the upgraded system will bring EPFO's services closer to a banking experience.

Blinkit, Zepto to raise commissions as quick commerce battle intensifies: ReportZepto has been steadily hiking commissions for both users and brands, focusing on unit economics, while Blinkit is rolling out a variable commission model.

entertainment.headline: Actor Helly Shah on TV's future: We need to up our gameActor Helly Shah talks about her comedy debut, TV's regressive content, and her Bollywood aspirations. She also shares that she dreams of playing bold and tough roles.

Lollapalooza Day 2: Louis Tomlinson, Aurora, Green Day make thunderous India debutMumbai's Mahalaxmi Racecourse became the epicentre of music as Lollapalooza India 2025 wrapped up Day 2. From Green Day's electrifying debut to indie rock and soulful serenades, it was a night of musical magic.

Security sought for Rashmika Mandanna after MLA's 'teach her a lesson' remarkAn association seeking rights for natives of Karnataka's Coorg (Kodagu) region, Codava National Council, urged the state authorities to provide security for actor Rashmika Mandanna. According to the council, the actor was being unfairly targeted after Congress MLA Ravi Ganiga claimed she refused to attend a Kannada film industry event.

Shankar Mahadevan remembers 'guiding light' Zakir Hussain on birth anniversaryIt was legendary tabla maestro Zakir Hussain's 74th birth anniversary on Sunday. Marking the occasion, singer and composer Shankar Mahadevan honoured him with heartfelt birthday wishes on social media.

Lady Gaga recalls psychosis diagnosis and how she felt 'ashamed' to talk about itIn an interview, singer Lady Gaga discussed her personal struggles that kept her away from music. She shared insights into her mental health journey, being diagnosed with psychosis and the support from her partner, Michael Polansky.

The Last of Us 2 trailer: Pedro Pascal and Bella Ramsey promise thrilling returnThe first full trailer of The Last of Us Season 2 is here. Starring Pedro Pascal and Bella Ramsey in lead roles, the HBO Max series promises a bigger and better season.

Lollapalooza India Day 1: Shawn Mendes must return for a solo concert in IndiaThe first day of Lollapalooza India 2025 kicked off on a grand note with Canadian singer Shawn Mendes' electrifying performance. The show also witnessed performances by several Indian artists, like Jonita Gandhi and Divine among others.

Shawn Mendes honours Virat Kohli, wears Team India jersey at Mumbai show. WatchSinger Shawn Mendes impressed fans with his debut India performance on March 8 at the Lollapalooza Mumbai show. During the concert, the singer delighted fans by wearing Virat Kohli's Team India jersey.

Mindy Kaling reacts to criticism of Meghan Markle's With Love, MeghanActor and creator Mindy Kaling has finally reacted to the criticism of Meghan Markle's lifestyle series, With Love, Meghan. The show premiered on Netflix on March 4.

Rishab Sharma on popularising Sitar, starting his own clothing brandRenowned 26-year-old sitar player Rishab Rikhiram Sharma blends classical and modern music. Trained under Ravi Shankar, he performs globally, including at the White House. Known for his mehendi-adorned hands, he also creates music for mental health.

What Rick Hoffman's entry as Louis Litt means for Suits LAActor Rick Hoffman will be reprising his iconic character, Louis Litt, from 'Suits', in one of the upcoming episodes of 'Suits LA'. The news comes days after the show received bad reviews for lacking excitement like the original one.

Why sitarist Rishab Sharma wears mehndi for every performanceSitarist Rishab Sharma embraces mehndi as part of his stage presence, blending tradition with innovation. The young sitarist shares how he enhances performance aesthetics while breaking stereotypes.

Sitarist Rishab Sharma: Said no to performing at White House initiallyRenowned sitarist and internet sensation Rishab Sharma opened up about performing at the White House, choosing the sitar over guitar, and more, during his appearance at India Today Conclave 2025 in New Delhi on Friday.

Shabana Azmi says Shibani Akhtar 'pulled her by the ear' to join Dabba CartelShabana Azmi revealed at the India Today Conclave 2025 that Shibani Akhtar "pulled her by the ear" to make her join Dabba Cartel. Shibani always envisioned her as part of the series.

Shabana Azmi on Dabba Cartel, rise of OTT, and feminism in cinema. VideoAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Shabana Azmi spoke about her role in Dabba Cartel, emphasising that 'power can be quiet'. Co-creator Shibani Akhtar revealed that the concept was built around the idea of a "Shabana Azmi drug cartel" from the outset. The series presents a compelling narrative of women coming together in solidarity within a crime drama, with Azmi's nuanced and quiet yet powerful performance serving as its anchor. Her portrayal marks a significant thematic shift in Indian storytelling. Jyotika also shared her experience and connection to her character, highlighting how the roles reflect real-life struggles faced by women, as well as themes of feminism and women's emancipation.

Jyotika on working with Shabana Azmi in Dabba Cartel: She was a friend to usActor Jyotika was recently seen in the newly-released show Dabba Cartel. At India Today Conclave 2025, she spoke about her character in the crime drama, her camaraderie with Shabana Azmi and what drew her to Dabba Cartel.

Shabana Azmi, Jyotika and Shibani Dandekar open up about making Dabba Cartel. PicsDabba Cartel actors Shabana Azmi, Jyotika and creator Shibani Dandekar graced the India Today Conclave 2025 on Friday, where they shared their experience of creating the Netflix series.

Unpopular opinion: Korean star Lee Min-ho is overratedSouth Korean star Lee Min-ho is a beloved actor. But he is certainly not the most talented or versatile artiste out there. Min-ho is currently seen in the show, When the Stars Gossip, which is streaming on Netflix.

With Love, Meghan review: You are neither fancy nor rich enough for Markle's show Released-Wed Mar 05, 2025With Love, Meghan could have been a lovely show about cooking and lifestyle, but it becomes a window into Markle's pretentiousness. It can't do away with its elitism, the one thing that Markle stood against during her stint at the royal palace.

general news.headline: Uproar in J&K Assembly over Gulmarg fashion show, BJP says outrage unwarrantedAs the House assembled for the day, members of the Jammu and Kashmir's ruling National Conference (NC), the People's Democratic Party (PDP), and Independents stood up and raised the fashion show issue and also demanded a probe into how such an event could take place while people kept day-long Ramzan fasts.

Devendra Fadnavis backs calls for Aurangzeb's tomb removal with jab at CongressThis comes a week after Samajwadi Party's Abu Azmi sparked controversy by praising Mughal emperor Aurangzeb. He claimed that Aurangzeb had built temples and was not a cruel emperor.

Why Pakistan representatives were missing from Champions Trophy closing ceremonyThe reason why there were no Pakistan representatives at the Champions Trophy closing ceremony has been revealed as an ICC spokesperson spoke to India Today about the situation. The absence of PCB officials at the closing ceremony created a lot of backlash, with Shoaib Akhtar being one of the people voicing his displeasure.

Why are women more prone to weight issues?Throughout different life stages, puberty, pregnancy, and menopause, hormonal fluctuations can lead to increased fat accumulation.

Thaw in India-Canada ties soon? What Trudeau's successor Mark Carney saidMark Carney, a former Goldman Sachs executive, was on Sunday named Justin Trudeau's successor as the Prime Minister of Canada and leader of the ruling Liberal Party. Trudeau resigned in January, months after facing a stiff internal revolt with demands for him to step down.

11 of 12 toilets clogged, Chicago-Delhi Air India flight turns back mid-airThe airline, however, said that the flight made a U-turn after being airborne for more than five hours due to a technical issue.

Trudeau resigned in January, months after facing a stiff internal revolt with demands for him to step down.

Blood moon on Holi: Will India witness Total Lunar Eclipse?The phenomenon is caused by the Earth's atmosphere scattering shorter wavelengths of light, allowing only red and orange wavelengths to reach the Moon's surface.

Kerala teen follows online weight-loss plans, dies after extreme dietingAn 18-year-old girl from Kerala's Kannur district died due to health complications linked to extreme dieting. She reportedly followed online weight-loss plans and had a deep fear of gaining weight.

Air India's New York flight returns to Mumbai after threat note found in toiletAn Air India flight from Mumbai to New York was forced to return mid-air after a potential security threat was detected onboard. Woman, friends burn cat alive after it crosses their path in UP's MoradabadThe incident took place in the Bhojpur police station area. SP Dehat Kunwar Akash Singh said that the Delhi's Wildlife Crime Control Bureau received an email complaint along with a video, prompting action.

The pacer missed the summit clash due to an injury and was left in tears ahead of the game on Sunday.

Champions Trophy victory proves why Gambhir is right man for white-ball jobGautam Gambhir secured his first ICC title as the India head coach on Sunday, March 9. After his title win, Gambhir stayed away from the limelight, making sure that he did not take the focus away from the players who had played near flawless cricket to secure the trophy.

IND vs NZ: Rohit Sharma's approach puts fear in bowlers, says Mitchell SantnerNew Zealand captain Mitchell Santner praised Rohit Sharma for his performance in the final of the Champions Trophy 2025. Rohit's 76 set up the thrilling chase for India on Sunday, March 9 in Dubai against the Blackcaps.

New Zealand is a very clinical team, satisfying to beat them: Rohit Sharma Champions Trophy 2025: Indian captain Rohit Sharma said that New Zealand is a very clinical team, and it was satisfying to beat them in the final on Sunday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

'Silent hero' Shreyas Iyer was brilliant: Rohit Sharma credits India batterChampions Trophy 2025: Rohit Sharma praised Shreyas Iyer for showing consistency and helping India win the title with a four-wicket win over New Zealand in the final in Dubai on Sunday.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli surpass MS Dhoni: Champions Trophy triumph in numbersChampions Trophy final: India defeated New Zealand on Sunday in the final to become the most-successful team in the tournament's history. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli won their fourth ICC title, eclipsing MS Dhoni.

Foretold, feared, fulfilled; but final should have been played in LahoreIndia's Champions Trophy win was like a war never fought but already won. With a team as relentless as Sparta's 300 and a batting lineup that rose like demons from every fallen wicket, this victory was never in doubt -- only a story waiting to be told.

Caution with aggression: Gavaskar praises Rohit Sharma after 76 in final Champions Trophy 2025: In an interview with India Today, Sunil Gavaskar heaped praise on Rohit Sharma for mixing caution with aggression and helping India beat New Zealand in the final on Sunday in Dubai.

Cribbers might crib: Gavaskar says India the best white-ball team on the planetChampions Trophy 2025: The legendary Sunil Gavaskar said that India is the best white-ball team on the planet, having played in the finals of the last three ICC limited-overs events.

Hardik Pandya delighted to bury the ghosts of 2017 after triumphIndia all-rounder Hardik Pandya said that he was delighted to bury the ghosts of the 2017 Champions Trophy final following India's win in the 2025 edition. India beat New Zealand by four wickets to win the Champions Trophy 2025.

Watch: Virat Kohli touches Shami's mother's feet after Champions Trophy winChampions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli met Mohammed Shami's family and touched the pacer's mother's feet after India won the tournament with a four-wicket win over New Zealand on Sunday.

Hardik Pandya delighted to bury the ghosts of 2017 after triumphIndia all-rounder Hardik Pandya said that he was delighted to bury the ghosts of the 2017 Champions Trophy final following India's win in the 2025 edition. India beat New Zealand by four wickets to win the Champions Trophy 2025.

Watch: Virat Kohli touches Shami's mother's feet after Champions Trophy winChampions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli met Mohammed Shami's family and touched the pacer's mother's feet after India won the tournament with a four-wicket win over New Zealand on Sunday.

Undisputed again? Rohit Sharma restores India's golden era in white-ball cricketRohit Sharma has spearheaded India's resurgence in white-ball cricket, leading them to back-to-back ICC titles and restoring their golden era. With no plans to retire soon, Rohit has now sets his sights on eclipsing MS Dhoni's legacy.

Harry Brook pulls out of IPL 2025, could face two-year ban from leagueEngland batting star Harry Brook announced his decision to withdraw from IPL 2025 on Sunday, March 9. Brook was bought by Delhi Capitals for Rs 6.25 crore in the mega auction.

Watch: Anushka celebrates with Rohit's family after India win Champions TrophyBollywood actor and Virat Kohli's wife, Anushka Sharma, was seen celebrating with Rohit Sharma's family after India won the ICC Champions Trophy 2025, beating New Zealand by four wickets in the final in Dubai on Sunday, March 09.

Wish Rohit Sharma scored a century but extremely proud of the team: Kapil DevLegendary India captain Kapil Dev said he wanted to see a century from Rohit Sharma in the Champions Trophy 2025 final against New Zealand. India captain got out for 76 (83) in the summit clash as the Men in Blue won the final by four wickets.

Watch: Gavaskar, Kapil Dev dance on live TV after India win Champions TrophyLegends Sunil Gavaskar and Kapil Dev danced on live television to celebrate India's Champions Trophy triumph. The former captains did not hold back and let their emotions flow while speaking to India Today after Rohit Sharma's men defeated New Zealand in Dubai on Sunday, March 09.

No Pakistan representative at trophy ceremony upsets Shoaib AkhtarChampions Trophy 2025: Legendary fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar expressed surprise over the absence of Pakistani representatives at the trophy presentation ceremony, despite Pakistan being the host nation.

Champions Trophy 2025 prize money: How much do India, New Zealand receive?India secured a massive $2.24 million after their Champions Trophy triumph, while ICC's prize pool distribution sees New Zealand, semi-finalists, and group-stage teams rewarded with significant earnings in the tournament's increased $6.9 million total prize fund.

I am not going to retire from ODIs: Rohit Sharma puts rumours to bedStar India batter Rohit Sharma was questioned about his future plans following India's Champions Trophy 2025 triumph. The India skipper said that no rumours should be spread on his retirement as he has no such plans as of now.

India will dominate world cricket even after 'we are done': Virat KohliChampions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli reflected on India's team effort in Dubai. The former captain said he sees a bright future for the team after seniors, including him and Rohit Sharma, retire from the format.

Rohit Sharma explains why he did not change template despite criticismIndia captain Rohit Sharma won the player of the match award in the final of the Champions Trophy. Speaking after the match, Rohit explained why he did not change his template despite huge criticism ahead of the tournament.

Watch: Kohli and Rohit celebrate triumph with 'Dandiya' danceVirat Kohli and Rohit Sharma celebrated India's Champions Trophy triumph in style, breaking into a special dandiya dance with the match stumps after a thrilling four-wicket win over New Zealand in the final on March 9.

Rohit emulates Dhoni, surpasses Kapil with Champions Trophy winIndia captain Rohit Sharma emulated MS Dhoni and Sourav Ganguly as he became the third India captain to win the ICC Champions Trophy for the country. India beat New Zealand by four wickets in the final to secure their third triumph.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
